avalancheActivity.comment: Small sluffs have been seen in the area.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small windslabs could be present on S-SW aspects. Older snow is widely hardpakced and stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow has widely drifed to S-SW aspects. Older snow is widely hardpacked and stable. The bond between layers is unknown. Weak layers could be present in the snowpack, especially at high elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions. A blizzard passed the regions in N-NE winds on Thursday and Friday and avalanche danger is considerable. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in both regions and people traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills. New snow is in the Eastfjords, windslabs were present. A few avalanches have occurred in the area so the snowpack seems to be unstable.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions after NE-blizzards last week. The snowpack in the Eastfjords has some weak layers as well.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-NA-áttir og dálítil snjókoma. Frost til fjalla en um frostmark á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches occurred in the region after a N-NE blizzard at the end of last week. A few avalanches also occurred in the beginning of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: N and NE snowstorm passed the region in the end of last week and natural avalanches have widely fallen. A lot of snow has drifted into SE - NW aspects but the snowpack is unstable in all aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Last week, a lot of snow fell in two consecutive NE blizzards. Unstable wind slabs have widely formed. Snow pits from the region confirm the presence of unstable wind slabs with stiff melt-freeze snow beneath. Weak layers have been detected within the new snow but also between the new snow and the older snow. The wind slabs in SE - NW aspects have grown considerably and are unstable. People should avoid steep terrain while the snowpack is adjusting after the storm.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions. A blizzard passed the regions in N-NE winds on Thursday and Friday and avalanche danger is considerable. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in both regions and people traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills. New snow is in the Eastfjords, windslabs were present. A few avalanches have occurred in the area so the snowpack seems to be unstable.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions after NE-blizzards last week. The snowpack in the Eastfjords has some weak layers as well.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA 5-13 m/s og dálítil él af og til. Áfram kalt í veðri til fjalla, hlýnar örlítið á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several slab avalanches have occurred in the area in recent days. An avalanche released on the road to Kleifar in Ólafsfjörður and out into the sea on Friday morning. Two major avalanches fell on the road from Dalvík to Ólafsfjörður night before Saturday. Additionally, an avalanche fell on the road to Siglufjörður west of the Strákagöng tunnel. Two size 3 and 3.5 avalanches released above Dalvík on the night to Saturday. Avalanches of size 2-3.5 occurred in Ólafsfjörður, specifically in Arnfinnsfjall, Ósbrekkufjall, Auðnahyrna, and Bustabrekkudal, likely releasing night before Saturday or Friday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow in the forecasting area. The new snow is considered unstable and thick windslabs area expected in most aspects. Many natural avalanches released this weekend, human triggered avalanches are likely to occur.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow in the forecasting area after north blizzard on Friday and Saturday, later light snowshowers and drifting snow. Snowpit from Klettahnjúkur by Siglufjörður (23.03) showed significant instability between new and old snow. A propagation snow test indicated propagation at 35 cm and ECTP12 at this layer. Snow pit from Leyningsúlur (25.03) had similar results where CT12 and PST slid at 33cm. Several avalanches released in the area this weekend and considerable snow available to drift in the coming NA wind this week. Travellers in mountains are advised to be careful as human triggered avalanches area likely.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions. A blizzard passed the regions in N-NE winds on Thursday and Friday and avalanche danger is considerable. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in both regions and people traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills. New snow is in the Eastfjords, windslabs were present. A few avalanches have occurred in the area so the snowpack seems to be unstable.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions after NE-blizzards last week. The snowpack in the Eastfjords has some weak layers as well.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi éljagangur til fjalla næstu daga og viðvarandi N-NA átt næstu daga og kalt í veðri. Hvessir á miðvikudag og fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches were seen yesterday. Quite a few avalanches occurred last week, one triggered by snowmobiles in Norðfjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the area. Unstable windslabs could be present, especially on S-erly aspects. Little snow is at lower elevations, especially in the southern part.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow is in the area, especially in the northern part of the area. Wind slabs are present under the new snow, especially on southerly aspects after snowfall in north winds on Friday and Saturday. The snowpack is likely layered in most places and some weak layers could be present. Little snow is at lower elevations after periods of thaw, especially in S-Eastfjords.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions. A blizzard passed the regions in N-NE winds on Thursday and Friday and avalanche danger is considerable. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack and it could take a few days for the snowpack to develop and settle. Many natural slab avalanches have been falling in both regions and people traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills. New snow is in the Eastfjords, windslabs were present. A few avalanches have occurred in the area so the snowpack seems to be unstable.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently very unstable in the Westfjords and Tröllaskagi regions after NE-blizzards last week. The snowpack in the Eastfjords has some weak layers as well.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðlægar áttir og él næstu daga. Hvassara og dálítið hlýrra á miðvikudag og fimmtudag.
